meanings.definition: A person or machine that creates raised patterns or designs on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The embossers at the stationery store make beautiful designs on paper.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new embosser to add a special touch to my invitations.
meanings.sent3: The embossers had a race to see who could create the most intricate pattern.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was an embosser, leaving lasting impressions wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The embossers hummed as they worked, bringing life to plain surfaces.

meanings.sent1: She reached for the embossers to add texture to her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The embossers in the craft store came in various shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent3: The embossers decided to take a break after a long day of creating patterns.
meanings.sent4: His words were like embossers, leaving a lasting impact on everyone who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The embossers gleamed under the light, ready to work their magic on the paper.

meanings.definition: To create raised patterns or designs on a surface.
meanings.sent1: She carefully embossers the leather to give it a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: The artist embossers the metal sheet with intricate floral patterns.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat embossers paw prints all over the freshly painted floor.
meanings.sent4: His words embossers themselves into her heart, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor embossers the statue with intricate details, bringing it to life.
